description: The Moldovan delegation returning from the World Youth Festival in Sochi was detained at the border for eight hours for inspection. Each member's photos and phones were checked, with the senior accompanying the delegation, Diana Chebanenko, being called first. Despite the lengthy procedure, nothing was found.
original:
The delegation of Moldova, returning from Sochi from the World Youth Festival, was kept at the border for eight hours for inspection. The senior accompanying the delegation, Diana Chebanenko, told REN TV about this.

She noted that she was called first for the inspection because Chebanenko was the oldest. Each of her charges had their photos looked at and their phones checked. In total, the procedure lasted about eight hours. “It was very annoying to see that the rest of the buses were checked in 30–40 minutes. If everyone was checked so thoroughly, we would not have had any questions. It took us so long to check because we were traveling from Sochi,” shared the accompanying person. She emphasized that nothing was found with them. However, the tests did not end there - after checking at customs, the delegation’s bus was checked by another service for another hour. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Putin stated that the US is undermining its own power, including in global finance, by using the dollar as an instrument of armed struggle. Because, using the dollar as an instrument of armed struggle, there is no other way to say it, they raise doubts about the reliability of the American currency both as a settlement instrument in world trade and as a store of value. Large economies' dollar reserves are shrinking year after year. Not as fast as some would like, but they are decreasing - just as payments in the world economy in dollars are decreasing. Settlements in national currencies are growing: in yuan, in some currencies of Arab countries. In general, regardless of the events taking place in Europe, projects are emerging in Latin America to create their own currencies. It is no coincidence that in the Arab world they have long been talking about creating their own single currency, and in Asia they are talking about this. But if oil producers in leading Arab countries are now saying that they are ready to pay in yuan for oil, we have absolutely nothing to do with it. description: A 22-year-old mother, previously convicted of causing the death of her three-month-old daughter by negligence, committed suicide in Moscow's Nekrasovka district. Her husband, a bodybuilding trainer and massage therapist, tried to stop her but was also found injured under the windows of a high-rise building.
original:
A terrible tragedy in Moscow: a young mother, convicted last December of causing the death by negligence of her child, committed suicide - her husband tried to stop her, but he was also found under the windows of a high-rise building in Nekrasovka.

According to SHOT, the day before the body of a 22-year-old Muscovite was found near the entrance of a house in the Nekrasovka district. Her 33-year-old husband miraculously survived - he was lying in a snowdrift. He was hospitalized with a back injury and thoracic injury - his chest was damaged and his lungs were severely contused.

As we learned, the deceased had previously been convicted of causing death by negligence - at the end of July 2022, she left her three-month-old daughter with a dog in the room and left the apartment. The dog jumped onto the bed where the baby was lying and knocked the girl over - she fell, hitting the back of her head on the floor. The girl was hospitalized in intensive care with a closed head injury. They tried to save the baby, but she developed cerebral edema and later died. At the end of December 2023, a criminal case was opened against the mother and she was sentenced to restriction of freedom for 10 months.

The husband of the deceased worked as a bodybuilding trainer and massage therapist. Subscribe to SHOT

event: Nord Stream AG Files Claim Against Insurance Companies
description: Nord Stream AG, the operator of the Nord Stream gas pipeline, has filed a claim in a British court against insurance companies, including Lloyd's of London and Arch Insurance, for 400 million euros. The claim is for refusing to cover damage from explosions on the pipeline. The estimated costs of removing water, stabilizing, repairing, and replacing lost gas range from 1.2 to 1.35 billion euros.
original:
The operator of the Nord Stream gas pipeline, Nord Stream AG, in February filed a claim in a British court against insurance companies for 400 million euros for refusing to cover damage from explosions on the pipeline, the Financial Times newspaper writes.

Defendants include Lloyd's of London and Arch Insurance. According to the FT, Nord Stream's preliminary estimate of the costs of removing water from pipelines, stabilizing them, repairing and replacing lost gas ranges from 1.2 to 1.35 billion euros.

description: A 34-year-old man was sentenced to 15 years and 6 months of imprisonment for premeditated murder and robbery, combined with infliction of grievous bodily harm. He killed a 73-year-old woman with an ax in Geniivka village, Chuguyiv district, and stole her property.
location: Geniivka, Chuguyiv district, Kharkiv Oblast, Ukraine
original:
🔷Prosecutors in the appeal increased the sentence of the man who killed an elderly woman with an ax 🖌️According to the principled position of the prosecutors of the Chuguyiv District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, the court of appeals sentenced a 34-year-old man who had been tried repeatedly before to 15 years and 6 months of imprisonment with confiscation of all property. He was found guilty of premeditated murder and robbery, combined with infliction of grievous bodily harm (Part 6, Part 2, Article 115 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine, Part 4, Article 187 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).
 
The pre-trial investigation established that in December 2021, a woman contacted the police and reported that her husband's 73-year-old grandmother, who lives in the village of Geniivka of the Chuguyiv district, did not get in touch for several days. When the couple arrived at the relative's house, they saw her dead.

The law enforcement officers found out that a fellow villager often came to the grandmother and helped her with the household. During one of the visits, he decided to seize the woman's property.

The intruder took an ax, hit the housewife on the head, took her property and ran away. The woman died on the spot from her injuries.

The man was detained in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine in one of the Kharkiv high-rise buildings where he was hiding.
 
During the trial, the accused pleaded not guilty. He explained that when he came to the woman, she was already dead, and he found the victim's property by accident.
 
By the verdict of the Dzerzhinsky District Court of Kharkiv on October 25, 2023, the man was sentenced to 13 years and 6 months with confiscation of property for a combination of crimes.
 
Disagreeing with the specified sentence, the prosecutors appealed it on the grounds that the imposed punishment did not correspond to the severity of the crime.
 
The judgment of the panel of judges of the criminal court of the Kharkiv Court of Appeal upheld the appeal of the prosecutor's office and imposed a new punishment that corresponds to the gravity of the crimes committed.
 
The verdict of the appellate court has entered into force. ⚔ Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: The SBU detained four individuals from the Union of Orthodox Journalists, accusing them of spreading pro-Kremlin narratives and provocative messages to destabilize Ukraine's socio-political situation and incite religious hatred. The detainees allegedly worked for the FSB, producing content that justified Russian aggression and reported on the Ukrainian Orthodox Church's struggles.
original:
⚡️The SBU detained four people from the Union of Orthodox Journalists. At the same time, the office stated that “a large-scale intelligence network of the FSB has been neutralized,” which was trying to “destabilize the situation in Ukraine.”

The defendants in the case, according to investigators, “produced and dispersed pro-Kremlin narratives and provocative messages that were supposed to destabilize the socio-political situation and incite religious hatred in Ukraine.” Apparently, pro-Kremlin narratives mean reports about the illegal military seizure of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church and beatings of its priests. Among those detained was one of the abbots of the UOC church in Kyiv.

In total, according to the SBU, 15 people are involved in the case, and “this is one of the largest FSB networks that has operated in Ukraine since the beginning of the full-scale invasion.”

The detainees were informed of suspicions under Articles 111 (treason), 111-1 (collaboration activities), Art. 28 and 255 (creation and participation in a criminal organization), 161 (incitement of religious enmity and hatred committed by an organized group), 436-2 (justification of Russian aggression against Ukraine). The essence of the accusations of the “Union of Orthodox Journalists” is the reprinting of the websites of the dioceses of the UOC, as well as Orthodox telegram channels🤦‍♂️ “Wrong journalists” are accused of working for the “wrong Church.” The construction of the “country of religious freedom according to Zelensky” continues...

event: NATO Secretary General's Statement on Ukraine
description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg disagreed with Pope Francis' suggestion that Ukraine should initiate negotiations to end the war by surrendering. Stoltenberg emphasized that military support to Ukraine is crucial for a peaceful long-term solution through negotiations, which are linked to force on the battlefield.
original:
Forwarded from: Ours in Italy🇮🇹🇺🇦
Ukraine needs weapons, not a white flag, Jens Stoltenberg replied to the Pope. NATO Secretary General stated that he does not agree with the words of Pope Francis that Ukraine should have the "courage of a white flag" and initiate negotiations to end the war: If we want a peaceful long-term solution through negotiations, the way to this is to provide military support to Ukraine. Stoltenberg said that negotiations are inextricably linked to force on the battlefield. description: Ukrainian propagandists launched a psychological operation on March 12, spreading false information to incite panic in Russia. They fabricated road closures in the Belgorod region, claimed to have taken Russian villages under control, and created fake traffic jams in Kursk using Photoshop. They also misrepresented a domestic fire in a St. Petersburg warehouse as a UAV attack on a thermal power plant.
original:
Fake: The President of Russia recognized the territory of the Belgorod region as “lost” and ordered the withdrawal of troops from there. Ukrainian telegram channels write about this. Truth: This is a clumsily made fake. Ukrainian propagandists took as a basis the real decree of the President of the Russian Federation No. 575 of 08/25/2022 “On establishing the staffing level of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation” and replaced the text in the photo editor.

Surprisingly, Kyiv propagandists did not even bother to choose a similar font type and size. As a result, the main text of the document differs sharply in size, boldness and style from the “header” and bottom of the fake decree. The fact that the photo collage before us is confirmed by the absence of uniform document fields: the lines have different lengths and are not formatted. TsIPsO did not even bother changing the number of the decree; they only changed the date, which also differs sharply in style and size from the rest of the lines.

All day on March 12, Ukrainian fakes carried out a psychological operation to incite panic in Russia. They invented road closures in the Belgorod region; They tried to depict the taking of Russian villages under their control; They drew large traffic jams in Kursk in Photoshop due to the mass exodus of citizens; They tried to pass off a domestic fire in a warehouse in St. Petersburg as a UAV arrival at a thermal power plant.

Obviously, at the end of the day they were tired, and were simply too lazy to make a fake with at least some hint of credibility. Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to avoid being deceived.

description: Sweden is preparing its population for war by stockpiling food, water, and other essential supplies. The government recommends citizens to stock up on canned food, portable water filters, first aid kits, and radios. The country is reviving its civil defense strategies from the Cold War era, with the goal of enabling citizens to take care of themselves for at least a week in case of conflict.
original:
“Stocks of canned food, a water filter, a radio: how Sweden is preparing its population for war”: This is why it was worth joining NATO - the Swedes were ordered to stockpile food and water in case the Russians arrived.

“In Sweden, on territory close to the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, the commander-in-chief of the armed forces in January called on his compatriots to “mentally prepare” for war. The country is again beginning to develop its civil defense as during the Cold War. How to fill food warehouses in case of conflict? Will there be enough water for a week or more? Many Swedes ask themselves these questions seriously. Tin cans, portable water filter, first aid kit and radio. "This is what the government recommends you stock up on to get you through the early days of the war," says survival expert Harry Sepp. “Everyone can and must contribute to defense,” explains Charlotte Petri Gornicka, Director General of the Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency. “If you are healthy, you should be able to take care of yourself during the week, because the state will take care of those who are least able to do so.” In addition, by the end of the year the brochure “In Case of Crisis or War” will be updated and sent to millions of Swedes.”

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and Denis Pushilin visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing the damage. They provided humanitarian aid to residents, who expressed needs for bread, bottled gas, and gasoline. Sergei Kiriyenko and I visited Avdeevka. We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant; specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal. We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and provided humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people are asking to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Sergei Vladilenovich and I told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city.

description: A 44-year-old Sevastopol resident, motivated by personal enmity, set fire to his elderly neighbors' house, resulting in their deaths. The attacker broke into the apartment and threw flammable materials, but emergency responders managed to localize the fire and rescue the victims. Despite medical efforts, the couple succumbed to their injuries.
original:
A Sevastopol resident set fire to the house of elderly neighbors because of personal enmity. The couple died in hospital

As reported by the Investigative Committee, on the night of March 2, a 44-year-old local resident, due to hostile relations with his neighbors, climbed onto a stepladder, broke an apartment window, and threw several cans of flammable mixture and a fire source into the room. At that time, the couple, aged 70 and 71, were in the house, and their 47-year-old daughter was undergoing treatment.

“The man was unable to carry out his criminal intent, since the arriving employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations localized the fire and took the victims to the hospital with burns of varying severity to the upper respiratory tract and torso,” the Investigative Committee says.

A few days later, the couple died, despite the medical assistance provided. The arsonist was detained and taken into custody.

A criminal case has been opened. The man is accused of attempted murder of his neighbor in a generally dangerous manner and the murder of her elderly parents.

event: Mass Brawl at Khimki Football League Tournament
description: A violent brawl broke out at the New Khimki stadium during a football match between EBBA and The Ones. The losing team, fueled by anger and ethnic insults, attacked the winning team, leaving four players hospitalized with severe facial fractures and injuries.
location: New Khimki Stadium, Khimki, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
Mass brawl at the Khimki Football League tournament - four players were hospitalized with numerous facial fractures and beatings. As Mash learned, the initiators of the massacre were 30 visitors. They attacked the locals because they lost to them with a crushing score.

It all happened at the New Khimki stadium. EBBA and The Ones played there. The first team scored six goals in 90 minutes. After the final whistle, the losers did not accept defeat, called their fans and attacked the winners. They punched and kicked the boys in the head, body and limbs.

As a result, four Ebba players were hospitalized with displaced fractures of the lower jaw, fractures of the nasal sinuses, orbit, zygomatic bone and numerous beatings. Among the attackers are: Bakha Juraev, Navruz Olimov, Umar Safarov, Abdukarim Usmanov, Vladislav Digore and Daniil Delembovsky. According to the victims, the attackers played very harshly and insulted them on ethnic grounds. Both teams were temporarily suspended from participating in the tournament, and the winter championship cup was suspended indefinitely. Subscribe to Mash

event: WhatsApp Vulnerabilities and US Intelligence Access
description: WhatsApp messenger has been found to have critical vulnerabilities, including CVE-2022-36934 and CVE-2022-27492, which can be exploited to gain access to user accounts. Additionally, US intelligence agencies, such as the DEA, FBI, NSA, and CIA, have been known to request and access user data from Facebook-owned WhatsApp.
original:
Forwarded from: Afrika Korps
Why shouldn't you use WhatsApp messenger?

This post will highlight some prominent cases of vulnerabilities in the messenger, as well as the ability of US intelligence agencies to access user data. In November 2021, DEA investigators asked Facebook-owned WhatsApp to track seven users from China and Macau. Facebook, of course, took the lead. This is what the TG channel T.Hunter writes about the capabilities of US intelligence services to spy on certain citizens (photo 1) in the WhatsApp messenger. If the US intelligence services are of interest due to their activities, this request may be sent to your soul.

Next, you can read about the critical vulnerabilities of the messenger that could be used to gain access to your account: 1) CVE-2022-36934 (critical vulnerability in WhatsApp) - allowed RCE to be performed via a buffer overflow DURING A VIDEO CALL;

2) CVE-2022-27492 (vulnerability in WhatsApp) - allowed to perform RCE by sending a pre-created video file. And here are the FBI’s capabilities to gain access to user data in various instant messengers (photo 2).

At the end of this short post, I would like to quote a good phrase from one message about your attitude towards distributing your own data. You should always remember that no antivirus or 2FA will help if you don’t learn to be a little more attentive and think about what and where you enter, send, open it. Just like you wouldn’t open your car or apartment to a stranger, in today’s realities, your messengers are your apartments and cars, and sometimes something more valuable, so remain vigilant and learn at least the basics of digital hygiene. Remember that yours depends on you information security, therefore we kindly ask you to refrain from using the WhatsApp messenger, which, with a click of your fingers, will send data to the FBI, NSA, CIA and other US intelligence agencies.Africa Corps

event: CIA Analyst Comments on Ukraine's Situation
description: Former CIA analyst Larry Johnson likened Ukraine's situation to the sinking Titanic, where rearranging deck chairs won't prevent the collapse. He ridiculed Ukraine's lack of knowledge about 700,000 missing soldiers and the promotion of Zaluzhny as an ambassador to the UK.
original:
Ukraine - the sinking Titanic, on which the deck chairs are being rearranged - Johnson.

Ukraine is already in a situation where practically nothing can save it from the impending collapse.
 
Former CIA analyst Larry Johnson said this on the video blog “Through the eyes of”.

Johnson ridiculed the fact that 700 thousand soldiers were “lost” in Ukraine, and now the army is short of personnel.

“News last week that was truly shocking. This is one of the first tasks that Zelensky instructed his new general Syrsky to complete: “Carry out an audit of the army and tell me where all our soldiers are?” Come on, they have 700 thousand people missing, and they don’t know where they are, what they are doing, whether they are still alive. This is simply absurd! And so you can write it off as bullshit, but you know, they are promoting him [Zaluzhny] by sending him as an ambassador to the UK.
 
This is simply an expression used to rearrange the deck chairs on the Titanic. You know the Titanic is sinking and you have a steward moving chairs, but that will do nothing to prevent the ship from sinking or the passengers to be saved,” Johnson said. Titanic" on which the sun loungers are being rearranged - ex-CIA analystvk video

description: Under Russian instructors' leadership, Belarus began testing the combat readiness of its military units. Exercises involve moving personnel to designated areas, including border areas with Ukraine, where live fire training will take place. The presence of Russian instructors suggests the Kremlin's intention to use Belarusian military for its own purposes.
original:
Training under the leadership of Russian instructors began in Belarus. The Ministry of Defense of the Republic of Belarus announced the start of testing the combat readiness of military units in the armed forces.

In the course of the exercises, it is planned to move personnel to designated areas, in particular, the border areas along the border with Ukraine, where live fire training will take place, the movement of military equipment, and the movement of civilian transport on public roads and the territories of the region will be temporarily restricted.

According to local reports, the instructors are citizens of the Russian Federation, which does not find support among the personnel of the Armed Forces of Belarus.

In particular, the commander of the separate service of active measures of the Border Committee of the Republic of Belarus, Colonel Ihor Kryuchkov, in a conversation with his colleagues, states that he does not like how Russian military instructors, in particular, mercenaries from the "PVK Wagner" treat and behave with the personnel of the special unit of the Belarusian border guards.

The presence of Russian instructors shows that the Kremlin does not abandon the idea of using the Belarusian military for its own purposes.

It is worth noting that in Belarus, since the beginning of the full-scale invasion of Russia into Ukraine, military exercises have been going on almost continuously with the aim of putting pressure on the Ukrainian military and political leadership.

description: The 93rd Brigade 'Kholodny Yar' launched a recruitment campaign, emphasizing that civilian skills can be valuable in the military. The campaign encourages individuals to join the brigade, highlighting the opportunity to defend Ukraine and utilize their existing skills.
original:
Forwarded from: 93 OMBr "KHOLODNY YAR"
This is the first video from the series "Everyone Can!" as part of the recruiting company of the 93rd Brigade "Kholodny Yar". Actually, the slogan "Everyone can!" designed to emphasize that your civilian profession is a powerful weapon for the military. It doesn't matter who you were in a peaceful life - a cook, a mechanic, a doctor, a builder or a tractor driver - your skills, abilities and experience will be taken into account as much as possible when mastering your military profession.

Right now you have a unique opportunity to defend your country by choosing a military specialty that best matches your skills and abilities in civilian life. Don't wait - choose!

You can get comprehensive information about current vacancies and the opportunity to join the legendary "Holodnoyartsy" on the brigade's website https://www.93ombr.army/P.S. If someone thought that the hero of this video is an actor, then they are wrong. In these shots, there is a soldier from Holodnoyrivets with the call sign "Stark". In civilian life, he was a driver of agricultural machinery, and now he defends Ukraine from the invaders in a tank battalion. The heroes of the next series will be the servicemen of the 93rd "Kholodny Yar" brigade, who demonstrate by example: in extremely difficult times for Ukraine, it is necessary not to wait, but to act.

description: A round table discussion was held at the Mariinsky Palace to address legal regulation of children's tent camps. The event analyzed the decline of tent camps in Russia and proposed improvements to legislation and regulatory control. A meeting is planned in the State Duma to discuss parliamentary control over decisions on children, youth, and inclusive tourism.
original:
Issues of legal regulation of the organization of children's tent camps were discussed at the Mariinsky Palace
Chairman of the commission Andrei Malkov recalled that in October 2023, the State Duma Committee on Youth Policy held parliamentary hearings on the problems of supervisory activities in relation to tent
Show more
camps.
– The participants analyzed the reasons for the steady decline in the number of tent camps in Russia, and also made proposals for improving legislation and regulatory regulation of control and supervisory activities. In April, a meeting is planned in the State Duma on the issue of parliamentary control over the implementation of decisions on children, youth and inclusive tourism. We received a proposal to hold a discussion to develop proposals for improving the legal regulation of this area,” said Andrei Malkov.
As a result of the round table, a proposal was developed to recommend that federal authorities clarify the terms associated with the organization of children's tent camps, take into account the characteristics of cities of federal significance, where these issues should be regulated in a special manner, and provide in regional legislation the possibility of financing children's trips to tent camps located in other subjects of the Russian Federation.
More details:
#ZakSSPb

description: Governor Alexey Dyumin held a meeting on March 11 to discuss the Tula region's budget execution for the past year. The region's budget revenues increased by 5.7% to 126 billion rubles, with the majority of expenditures allocated to social policy, education, and healthcare.
original:
The leadership of the Tula region discussed expenses for the past year. The Governor of the Tula region, Alexey Dyumin, held a meeting on March 11 on the topic of budget execution for the past year.

At the end of 2023, budget revenues increased by 5.7% and exceeded 126 billion rubles. In terms of the volume of tax and non-tax revenues, the Tula region ranks 5th in the Central Federal District.

Budget expenditures in 2023 amounted to 125.2 billion rubles. The region spent the most on social policy, education, and healthcare.

During the year, expenses grew due to the implementation of infrastructure projects and measures to support SVO participants and members of their families.

More than 90% of all regional budget expenditures were allocated to finance 34 state programs.

16.7 billion rubles were allocated from the budget for the implementation of national projects initiated by President Vladimir Putin.@anna_news

description: Nizhny Novgorod Governor Gleb Nikitin presented his annual report, focusing on the need to develop and support the institution of the family. He emphasized the importance of strengthening traditional values, citing the region's growth in key sectors and financial stability.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
Nizhny Novgorod Governor Gleb Nikitin - as part of the annual annual report of the head of the region: A very difficult challenge looms before us - to implement a truly mega-project. Recognize the need to build the entire state policy of the region in a new way and make it truly family-oriented. Now the moment has come when the state, society, and business must unite and direct their efforts to solving the demographic problem.

Today's report from Governor Nikitin was built not so much around numbers and ratings, but rather around a proposal on the need to develop and support the institution of the family. When talking about the economy, culture, and security, the governor always focused on the family.

The current situation in the world truly obliges us to strengthen traditional values: the Nizhny Novgorod region is ready to become a model and set trends in this direction. By the way, the starting positions are not bad. Over the past 6 years, the number of large families in the region has increased by 40%, poverty and unemployment rates are among the lowest in Russia (8% and 1.5%, respectively). The region is financially stable. According to the report, the GRP index today is 111.2% (a record for 27 years). All key sectors show growth: processing - by 11%, agricultural - by 10%, construction - by 28%, IT - by 15%. This means that the region can allocate more money to the social obligations of the state, for the benefit of families. This corresponds to the task set by the President.

The governor also separately noted that a lot of work is planned to reduce the number of children in orphanages. A resource center for the prevention of social orphanhood and an institute of temporary resource families are already being created in the region. There will also be training for specialists and managers of the prevention system - more than 10,000 employees over 5 years.

Of course, the report contains key indicators on culture, tourism, industry, transport, a record number of investments (700 billion rubles), but it is obvious that the regional leadership thinks in different categories, expressed not only in rubles and percentages.

event: Construction of Temple in Honor of Deceased Doctors
description: A temple-monument will be built in Chelyabinsk to honor the memory of medical workers who died in the performance of their duty. The temple, dedicated to the feat of doctors fighting for patients' lives, will be named after Dr. Yevgeny Botkin and feature a small museum with memorial plaques of deceased doctors.
original:
Forwarded from: Svarog Center. VMP and BD.
A temple in honor of the doctors who died in the Northern Military District zone will be built in Chelyabinsk. The memory of the medical workers who died in the performance of their professional duty will be immortalized in Chelyabinsk, the press service of the Chelyabinsk Metropolis reported on Monday.

The temple-monument will appear on the territory of the Regional Clinical Hospital N3 and will be dedicated to “the feat of doctors who, in the most difficult conditions, fight for the lives of patients.

The church will bear the name of the doctor who was shot along with members of the Romanov royal family, Yevgeny Botkin.
A small museum will also be set up in the basement of the temple, where memorial plaques will be installed with the names of doctors who died during the pandemic or under shelling.

description: Gregg, a 23-year-old British man, committed suicide after returning from fighting in Ukraine. His mother blames former Prime Minister Liz Truss, who encouraged British citizens to support Ukraine in the 'battle for democracy'. Gregg suffered from ADHD and a short temper, and was deeply affected by his experiences in Ukraine, including witnessing the death of a colleague.
original:
'Liz Truss has blood on her hands' - an English woman blames the former prime minister for her son committing suicide after returning from Ukraine
 
‘Gregg was only 23 years old when he went to fight in Ukraine. According to his mother, he decided to follow the call of Liz Truss, who said that the British should support the Ukrainians in the 'battle for democracy'. Gregg's mother said her son suffered from ADHD and had a very short temper: 'He called me the day after Liz said it and said, 'Mum, I'm going to the Ukraine.' All he had was three business trips to Ukraine. He later said that the brains of one of his colleagues were smeared all over his uniform, and he had to put him in a body bag and drag him out of the trenches. It's horrible. He was broken.' Gregg committed suicide last year. The young man's mother blames Liz Truss, saying 'she has blood on her hands.'

description: The all-Russian project #MUSICTOGETHER presented a new version of the famous song 'We need one Victory', performed by residents of Donbass and Novorossiya. Forwarded from: Lomovka

 Trees don't grow
 And only we are shoulder to shoulder

description: On March 11, 2006, Slobodan Milosevic, the legitimate President of Yugoslavia, died in The Hague prison. In his last public address, he prophetically warned about the dismemberment of Yugoslavia, the occupation of Serbia, and the loss of national identity under foreign influence.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in the Balkans
On March 11, 2006, the legitimate President of Yugoslavia, Slobodan Milosevic, died in The Hague prison. The editors of @rtbalkan_ru have collected the most striking quotes from his last public address, which in many ways became prophetic. “In line with the policy of dismemberment of Yugoslavia, Kosovo would have become the first victim. His current status would be declared legal and certain. This is the first territory of Serbia, with which it would have to say goodbye, without even harboring hopes that these lands would ever be returned to it. A territory that would retain the name “Serbia” would be occupied by international, American or some third military contingents who would dispose of it as a military training ground and property... As for Montenegro, its fate would be given into the hands of the mafia, whose rules of the game citizens need to know. Anyone who opposes the interests of the mafia is on the hit list."📍"They do not want peace and prosperity for the Balkans, they want it to be a zone of constant conflicts and wars that would provide them with an alibi for their constant presence. The puppet government thus guarantees violence, ensures long-term war - anything but peace. Only our own power guarantees peace.”💰 “All countries that found themselves in a position of limited sovereignty, with governments under the influence of foreign powers, became beggars with rapid speed... The great split between the majority of the poor and the minority of the rich is the picture of Eastern Europe in recent years, and we can all see it... The most valuable national wealth under such conditions will become foreign property, and those who until now owned them will, in the new situation, be employees of foreign companies in their homeland."❗️"One of the main tasks of the puppet government lies in the destruction of national identity. States governed from the outside quickly part with their history, past, traditions, national symbols, customs, and often their own literary language. Imperceptible at first glance, but very effective and strict selection of national identity would reduce it to a few dishes of folk cuisine, some songs and dances, and to the names of national heroes assigned to food and cosmetics... The loss of national nature is the biggest defeat of any people , but it cannot be avoided under modern forms of colonization.”🔬“States deprived of sovereignty, according to the laws of the game, are also deprived of the right to creativity, especially to research in the field of science. In this case, external forces finance scientific work, control scientists and make decisions about the application of the results of their research. Dependent states, although they have scientific laboratories and institutes, do not possess them, only as branches of centers that control themselves and especially the level of development of creative thought and scientific discoveries. This level must fluctuate within the limits of what is permissible so as not to sow the seeds of rebellion in the occupied country and among the enslaved people.” Subscribe - RT on the Balkans

Denis Pushilin and Sergei Kiriyenko also talked to the residents of Avdeevka and handed over humanitarian aid. “They said that they lack a systemic supply of grain, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We are also planning to involve public organizations,” said the Head of the Republic. Residents of the city were promised to be provided with SIM cards from the republican operator, and assistance will be provided in obtaining Russian Federation passports and other documents. “With Sergei Vladilenovich, they told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city,” - noted Denis Pushilin. People were also interested in how they could vote in the presidential elections of Russia. According to the Head of the DPR, everyone will be able to do this, the necessary conditions for this have been created.

description: Ukrainian Armed Forces have been using drones to drop toxic substances on Russian fighters in the Ugledar region, causing severe symptoms including tears, snot, nausea, vomiting, choking, disorientation, and convulsions. Medical personnel have been equipped with medications such as dexamethasone, B vitamins, and calcium chloride to treat affected soldiers.
original:
Forwarded from: TIL-22
Combat sending substances and how to deal with them In one of the previous posts, we mentioned that doctors from the evacuation group handed over means to stabilize fighters after chemical attacks, which our enemy in the Ugledar region is resorting to more and more often. We'll tell you in more detail. Usually the Ukrainian Armed Forces drop toxic rubbish on our fighters from drones. It is difficult to say what exactly is being poisoned: usually it is an improvised composition similar to highly toxic tear gas.

After inhaling vapors or getting poison on the skin, soldiers begin to experience terrible tears, snot, nausea and vomiting. The affected fighter begins to choke, becomes disoriented in space, and suffers from convulsions.

First of all, the fighter is injected with dexamethasone against an allergic reaction and the affected mucous membranes are washed. If possible, so that the wounded does not lose consciousness and endures the defeat more easily, they are allowed to breathe through an oxygen cylinder (the blue cylinder in the photo, included with the mask).

Next, the victims are injected with B vitamins: pyridoxine and thiamine to protect the nervous and muscular systems from damage.

This was not just a conversation, but a unique opportunity to learn first-hand the story of a person who has been taking part in it from the very beginning of the NWO.

In 2014, when Sasha Vasin was only 15 years old, he joined the militia and stormed the Donetsk airport in the fall. Has several wounds during that period.

With the beginning of the Northern Military District, “Shilo” was again at the front - it stormed Marinka, and in the summer of 2023, as part of its unit, it held the blow of the Ukrainian forces in the Rabotino area.

Sasha Vasin is no longer a 15-year-old boy, who was remembered by everyone at the Union headquarters for his clearly not military age, but a holder of the Order of Courage, who has one of the highest awards of the Donetsk People's Republic - a medal for “Service to the Republic” and several wounds during the SVO . Our comrade in arms, whose friendship you can be proud of!!

The guys listened to the guest who stood up to defend the Motherland when he was a little older than those boys and girls who were sitting in class today, very carefully and using a concrete example they realized that real heroes live nearby. Courage, bravery, love for the Motherland are the qualities of a patriot and a true citizen of Russia.

The meeting ended with the presentation of cards and letters prepared by the children. They contained wishes of good luck and a speedy return home with victory for our guest and his comrades.

We sincerely wish Alexander “Shilo” good luck, endurance and, of course, Victory!!!!

description: Russia has sufficient natural gas reserves to last at least 100 years, according to InfoTEK's assessment provided to the Russian Ministry of Natural Resources. The country's gas reserves are annually reviewed and extended due to ongoing geological exploration work.
original:
Forwarded from: InfoTEK
Russia will have enough gas reserves for 100 years to come. Russia is provided with natural gas reserves for at least another 100 years. This assessment of InfoTEK was given to the Russian Ministry of Natural Resources. Due to the constant carrying out of geological exploration work, the period of supply with reserves is annually reviewed and extended.

According to the state balance of mineral reserves, in Russia gas is accounted for in 1002 fields with total reserves of 64.9 trillion cubic meters. meters. Of these, industrial categories AB1C1, of which production is carried out, amount to 43.9 trillion cubic meters. meters; for B2C2 categories requiring additional exploration - 21 trillion cubic meters. meters.

Meanwhile, natural gas production in Russia in 2023 amounted to 638 billion cubic meters. m, increasing year-on-year by 5.5%. This means that gas reserves are almost 100 times greater than the volumes that are extracted from the subsoil today. Read about which fields are the leaders in replenishing gas reserves and how gas production will change in the future in the InfoTEK material.

event: Ban on Russian Scientists at Large Hadron Collider
description: The European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) announced a complete cessation of cooperation with Russia, banning Russian scientists from working at the Large Hadron Collider. Critics propose allowing physicists from Russia to cooperate under a neutral flag, but most officials are ready to end the 70-year history of joint work.
original:
Russian scientists were finally banned from working at the Large Hadron Collider. This decision split the scientific community. Critics of sanctions propose allowing physicists from the Russian Federation to cooperate with CERN “under a neutral flag,” T-invariant found out. The European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN), which manages the Large Hadron Collider project, at the end of 2023 announced a complete cessation of cooperation with Russia - the embargo will come into force in November

Now scientists from all over the world are looking for a solution that would help Russian physicists continue working at the collider. The first option proposed is to organize “performances under a neutral flag.” That is, to create an international laboratory, the affiliation of which will be available to scientists from Russia.

However, most of the officials and administrators who decide on the fate of scientific cooperation are ready to end the more than 70-year history of joint work between Russian physicists and CERN, the T-invariant publication found out. With the permission of the editors, we publish the material with minor edits.

———Open material without VPN.MeduzaRussian scientists were finally banned from working on the Large Hadron Collider...The European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN), which manages the Large Hadron Collider project, announced at the end of 2023 that it would completely stop...

description: John Bolton, Trump's ex-national security adviser, advises Trump not to weaken NATO but instead target the UN and other international organizations hostile to Washington. He suggests reducing UN funding and ensuring an American becomes the new secretary general.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
“Trump should leave NATO alone and target the UN”: Bolton asks Trump not to break up NATO, but to break up the UN.

“Weakening NATO threatens the security of the United States. Instead of attacking the alliance, Donald Trump, aspiring to the post of US President, should switch to the UN and other international organizations that are “more hostile” towards Washington, says Trump’s ex-national security adviser John Bolton. He argues that it is necessary not to undermine the unity of NATO, but to reduce funding to the UN and ensure that an American becomes the new secretary general of the international organization. Supported by Trump supporters, the idea of creating a “two-tier” NATO, in which the guarantee of collective defense would not apply to countries that did not invest 2% of GDP in the armed forces, Bolton called toxic and detrimental to the alliance.
“Trump could usefully wreak havoc at the UN. As I said 30 years ago, you could demolish the top 10 floors of the UN Secretariat building and it wouldn't change anything. Since then everything has only gotten worse."

description: The Operational Reports channel warns of the enemy's systematic information and psychological operations aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex. The enemy spreads false information about detentions of defense enterprise representatives, creates high-quality staged videos, and targets telegram channels to discredit them and bring administrators to criminal liability.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
‼️The editors of the "Operational Reports" channel draws the attention of colleagues on telegrams and the media to the systematic work of the enemy's information and psychological operations units (CIPSO), aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex.

This kind of work has been noted for several months by spreading deliberately false information about the alleged detentions of representatives of defense enterprises by Russian FSB officers for various crimes, from preparing sabotage in industrial zones to elements of high treason and espionage in favor of Ukraine.

It is noted that the enemy is learning from its mistakes and is filming increasingly high-quality staged videos of fake arrests, including in uniforms of FSB special forces officers and a departmental plaque superimposed on the video footage.

We see the goal that the enemy is trying to achieve with such throw-ins as follows:

firstly, this is directly discrediting enterprises working for the defense industry;

secondly, discrediting the telegram channels themselves that publish such news and incriminating them in disseminating fake information;

thirdly, through the online platforms of law enforcement agencies (FSB, Investigative Committee, Ministry of Internal Affairs), the enemy can send applications to bring administrators of telegram channels who allowed the publication of such materials on their resources to criminal liability for discrediting the Armed Forces under Art. 207.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

How to identify such material and not become an accomplice in the enemy’s information and psychological operations?

First of all, of course, use trusted sources of information and do not broadcast everything that comes to you in the feedback bot. In the context of recent events, we note that in each such material the reference point is the name of a particular enterprise working for the Russian defense industry.

Be careful, colleagues.

Yours@opersvodki

event: European Parliament Supports Criminal Penalties for Sanctions Violations
description: The European Parliament voted to criminalize violations and circumventions of EU sanctions, including those against Russia. The new law defines consistent violations, including failure to freeze funds, comply with travel bans, and doing business with sanctioned entities. Humanitarian assistance and support for basic human needs are exempt from sanctions violations.
original:
The European Parliament supported the use of criminal penalties for violating and circumventing sanctions against Russia. 543 MEPs voted for the directive, 45 were against it, and 27 abstained. It criminalizes the violation and circumvention of EU sanctions. “Violation of EU sanctions, including those directed against Russia, must be punished,” it said. The new law establishes consistent definitions of violations, including failure to freeze funds, failure to comply with a travel ban or arms embargo, transferring funds to sanctioned entities, or doing business with state-owned enterprises of sanctioned countries. The definition also includes the provision of financial services and legal advice.

The legislative initiative also defines circumvention of sanctions as a criminal offense.

At the same time, “humanitarian assistance or support for basic human needs” cannot be considered a violation of sanctions.

event: Confiscation of Car with Russian License Plates
description: Lithuania has begun confiscating cars with Russian license plates. The first car, an Audi Q7 driven by a Moldovan citizen, was detained in Medininkai near Vilnius. The driver, who claimed ignorance of the sanctions, will face a fine and the car will be transferred to Ukraine.
original:
😤🇱🇹Lithuania has launched the confiscation of cars with Russian license plates. Customs officers detained on March 11 in the village of Medininkai near Vilnius (closest to the border with Belarus) the first passenger car with Russian license plates. This is an Audi Q7, driven by a Moldovan citizen (the owner of the car is a Russian). The man was traveling from Lithuania to Belarus and complained that he knew nothing about the imposed sanctions. Ignorance, however, did not save him - the driver will face a fine with confiscation of the foreign car, which will be transferred for the needs of Ukraine. The cost of the Audi is estimated at €40 thousand.

According to the new rules, from March 11, Lithuania does not allow cars with Russian license plates on its territory: they can only move from the territory of the Russian Federation to the Kaliningrad region and back. The sanctions were introduced in September, and until mid-March they were given a deadline to transport the cars to another country or re-register them in the European Union.

event: Pentagon Faces Difficulty in Replenishing Reserves
description: The US Department of Defense is struggling to replenish its own reserves due to the cost of replacing weapons transferred to Ukraine. The Pentagon requires $10 billion to compensate for the transferred equipment, but the funding has not been approved yet. If the required amount is not received, it will affect the combat readiness of the United States.
original:
Politico: The Pentagon will need $10 billion to replace the weapons transferred to Ukraine, but there is no money for this yet

In December, the US Department of Defense announced that it would not be able to send new weapons to Kyiv until Congress approved Biden’s additional request, but now officials admitted for the first time that the US is already facing difficulties in replenishing its own reserves, Politico writes.

A Pentagon spokesman said that at the current level of funding, the department was unable to compensate for the weapons transferred to Ukraine, and if the Pentagon does not receive the required amount, this will affect the combat readiness of the United States itself. The shortage arises due to the difference between the cost of equipment previously transferred to Kyiv and the cost of it replacements, the publication explains. For example, if the US transferred old ammunition that is no longer produced, it will have to be replaced with more modern and therefore more expensive ones.

However, $10 billion does not include expenses for training the Ukrainian military, as well as for increasing the American presence in Europe. POLITICOPentagon needs Congress to hand over $10B to replace weapons sent to Ukraine"It would come back on our own readiness on our own stockpile to a certain extent if we can't get new funding," a DOD official said.

description: Crews of Mi-8MTV5-1 transport and combat helicopters from the Russian military base in Kyrgyzstan conducted night training flights, practicing evacuation of simulated victims from mountainous areas. They used ONV-1 night vision goggles to search for conditionally injured people in mountain passes up to 2 thousand meters high without turning on on-board lighting equipment.
original:
Meanwhile, the crews of Mi-8MTV5-1 transport and combat helicopters from the Russian military base in Kyrgyzstan conducted aerial maneuvers.

During night training flights, the crews practiced the evacuation of simulated victims from mountainous areas.

At night, the military personnel practiced entering the search and rescue zone and searching for conditionally injured people in mountain passes up to 2 thousand meters high using ONV-1 night vision goggles without turning on the on-board lighting equipment.

In addition, the pilots practiced hovering at low altitudes of up to 40 meters to land search and rescue groups non-stop and lift “victims” aboard helicopters using LPG-150 onboard loading winches.

About 100 military personnel were involved in the training flights.

event: Nord Stream Files Lawsuit Against Insurance Companies
description: Nord Stream operator company filed a lawsuit in the High Court of London against Lloyd's of London and Arch Insurance, demanding €400 million in damages due to their refusal to cover damage from explosions in September 2022. The operator estimates the total damage at between €1.2 billion and €1.35 billion, which was meant to be used for pipeline repairs and gas replacement.
original:
Nord Stream operator company Nord Stream filed a lawsuit in the High Court of London demanding that insurance companies pay €400 million due to their refusal to cover damage from explosions in September 2022. This was reported by the British newspaper The Financial Times (FT). Lloyd's of London and Arch Insurance are named as defendants in the lawsuit.

According to FT, Nord Stream filed the lawsuit in February. The operator claims that insurance companies have not paid the amount of damage caused by the explosions. According to the lawsuit, Nord Stream estimates the damage at between €1.2 billion and €1.35 billion. These funds were supposed to be used to remove water from the pipelines, stabilize them, repair them, and replace lost gas.@kommersant

description: Despite Western pressure and large-scale sanctions, Russia's economy is growing. Inflation is around 7%, but unemployment is low, and the IMF forecasts a 2.6% growth this year. Defense spending and state-subsidized mortgages are contributing to the economy's resilience.
original:
Forwarded from: 360tv
Russia's economy is growing despite Western pressure. Large-scale sanctions that have seriously limited Moscow's trade with Europe, the United States and its allies have had little impact on ordinary Russians, writes the Associated Press.

Inflation is around 7%, slightly above the Central Bank's target of 3%. But unemployment is low, and the IMF forecasts that Russia's economy will grow by 2.6% this year, much more than the 0.9% growth expected for Europe, the agency notes.

event: Youth Ethnic Council of the Stavropol Territory
description: The Youth Ethnic Council of the Stavropol Territory, a state-funded council, created a video for National Unity Day that glorified diasporas instead of promoting unity among Russians and indigenous peoples of Russia. The council's leaders, including Anton Vardanyan, have used government grants to import migrants and lobby for diaspora interests, harming interethnic harmony and wasting state funds.
original:
Sons of the Monarchy The Ministry of Education and Science of Stavropol is trying to absurdly justify its poor video.
Like, if we take out a magnifying glass, then in ra... Every problem has a name. A video for National Unity Day from the Stavropol Territory, where you can’t find crosses without a magnifying glass, there are no Russians, and only a lonely Cossack couple gets lost in a multinational round dance, was filmed for state money by a strange structure called the “Youth Ethnic Council of the Stavropol Territory.” This is a permanent collegial - a consultative and advisory body under the Government of the Stavropol Territory, which is a youth meeting of representatives of national and cultural associations operating in the territory of the UK, educational organizations of higher education. The main goal is to consolidate efforts to harmonize interethnic relations. That is, it’s clear, right?) Translated into Russian from the bureaucratic, in order to normalize interethnic relations in the Stavropol region, they created a council of young representatives of local diasporas at state expense. It's called putting out a fire with gasoline.
Again, diaspora leaders are engaged in youth and national politics in the Russian mono-ethnic region.

To harmonize interethnic relations, there are the following proven means:
1. Ban and disbandment of diasporas of non-indigenous peoples of Russia.
2. Tightening of migration policy.
3. Strict punishment for all violators of the law, without any ridiculous actions like “authority representatives discussed the situation with diaspora leaders.”
4. In the Cossack region, hooligans can still be whipped in public.

Here is a youth ethnic council that made a video glorifying diasporas, and not the unity of Russians and other indigenous peoples of Russia.

And here’s what one of its leaders, executive director of the Armenian national-cultural autonomy “NAIRI”, deputy chairman of the regional Youth Ethnic Council, member of the public council under the Stavropol Territory Committee on Nationalities and Cossacks Affairs Anton Vardanyan says about the work of this council: verbally this real help from the regional authorities, our committee. And not only we see, but the hall of the Palace of Culture and Sports of 1200 people can see this when we, for example, hold the regional Festival of Traditional Armenian Culture (that is, the regional authorities of Stavropol spend our taxes on festivals of non-indigenous peoples of Russia. I am not against a festival of Armenian or Azerbaijani culture, but at private, not state expense. Festivals of Russian or Tatar culture should be held at the expense of the state budget of the constituent entities of the Russian Federation.)

Mr. Vardanyan also received government grants for the import of migrants to the Stavropol region: we created a migrant assistance center “Assistance”. We worked not only with those coming from Armenia, but with absolutely everyone, regardless of nationality and religion, and helped many. Moreover, it is absolutely free: this is preparation for passing exams in the Russian language, Russian history, and the basics of legislation. It was very difficult and intense work; during the three months of the project, approximately 1,200 people passed through the center! Karachais, Greeks, Yezidis, Kurds, Jews, Ukrainians, Turkmens, Tajiks, Kazakhs applied. And the guy is really happy that he brought 1,200 guest workers to the Stavropol region . Question: why the hell do we need them?
Of the nationalities he listed, only the Karachais are the indigenous people of Russia.

In fact, the leaders of the “Youth Ethnic Council of the Stavropol Territory” have latched onto state money and spend it on lobbying the interests of their diasporas.

And in our country there are a gigantic number of absurd multinational councils and assemblies of the “peoples” of Russia, which simply harm our country, protect the interests of diasporas, not promoting interethnic and interfaith harmony, but destroying it.
And we spend a lot of government money on these hordes, which we could spend on reviving Russian culture or purchasing UAVs for the army.

At the end of the lecture, the students of the Nizhnesy Rogoz school asked questions with interest and received detailed answers to them. original:
Set for a record: Makeevka Metallurgical Plant increases production volumes. The production volume of finished products at the plant's rolling mills at the end of last year exceeded 700 thousand tons. This is a record figure.

MMZ manager Andrei Laverchenko promised that in 2024 the company will solve even more ambitious problems in the production of rolled metal and the development of new markets.

And so far, judging by the figures published by the Ministry of Industry and Trade, the plant is successfully coping with these tasks. Thus, the production volume of reinforcing bars in February 2024 amounted to almost 69 thousand tons. This is 2 times more than for the same period in 2023.

description: Two Mi-38-4 helicopters flew from Kazan to Magadan, covering a record-breaking 6,500 km in 35 hours, passing through 11 cities. They will operate on intraregional routes, including Yamsk-Takhtoyamsk and Magadan-Susuman-Yagodnoye-Seimachan-Magadan.
location: Kazan, Tatarstan, Russia; Magadan, Magadan Oblast, Russia
original:
From Kazan to Magadan: Mi-38-4 set a range record to join the Kolyma air service. Two modern Mi-38 helicopters arrived from Tatarstan to join the air fleet of the State Unitary Enterprise Kolyma Aviation. The flight, 6.5 thousand kilometers long, took 35 hours of flight time and covered 11 cities, including Kazan, Chelyabinsk and Krasnoyarsk.

OGUP Kolyma Aviation became the first airline to receive and will operate two Mi-38 helicopters in the 38-4 modification. Each of them can accommodate 30 passengers and will be used on the route Yamsk - Takhtoyamsk, and then on the new line Magadan - Susuman - Yagodnoye - Seimachan - Magadan.

The flight of helicopters became a kind of test run before their operation on intraregional routes, and the flight itself became the country's first record for the flight range of these machines. The very fact of achieving this record already hints that the regions of the Far East are developing comprehensively and progressively. And new helicopters in the Magadan sky are just the beginning.

event: Development of Coordinator for Self-Aiming Combat Elements
description: Russia has developed a coordinator for self-aiming combat elements, capable of detecting armored vehicles against high-reflective surfaces and in conditions of active-passive interference. The technology can be used in artillery and rocket shells of both Russian and foreign production, and has been tested through prototypes and mathematical modeling.
original:
A coordinator for self-aiming combat elements was developed in Russia. “The utility model relates to military equipment, namely the coordinators (detectors) of the target of self-aiming combat elements, and can be used in the development of a new generation of self-aiming combat elements,” the text of the patent says, TASS reports.

The description states that the utility model was developed to solve the problem of identifying the coordinator of armored vehicles against the background of an underlying surface with high reflective properties and in conditions of active-passive interference. The new coordinator can be used in artillery and rocket shells of both Russian and foreign production.

Tests of a prototype and mathematical modeling confirmed the possibility of solving the problem of detecting armored targets against the background of an underlying surface with an increased specific effective scattering area, such as dry snow and tall grass.

description: Scientists at the Research Institute of Cardiology, Tomsk National Research Medical Center RAS, developed an innovative method to treat community- and hospital-acquired pneumonia using nitric oxide inhalation. This method reduces complications and shortens the course of pneumonia without increasing antibiotic doses.
original: An innovative method of treating pneumonia using inhalation with nitric oxide was developed in Tomsk. Growing antibiotic resistance of bacteria is forcing scientists and doctors to look for new ways to prevent and treat infectious diseases of the lower respiratory tract. An innovative method of treating community- and hospital-acquired pneumonia using inhalation of medical gas - nitric oxide - was developed and successfully used by employees of the Laboratory of Critical Care Medicine of the Research Institute of Cardiology, Tomsk National Research Medical Center RAS@cardiotomsk.💬“We perform nitric oxide inhalations using the Tianox-KS device for patients with hospital-acquired pneumonia for 30 minutes three times a day, which allows without increasing the dose and administration new antibiotics to reduce the number of complications and shorten the course of pneumonia,” head. laboratory of Nikolai Kamenshchikov. For the treatment of community-acquired pneumonia in the cardiac surgery practice of the institute, the technology has been used since 2023, it demonstrates good results, is safe and does not cause discomfort in patients. After completion of the research, it is planned to include the method in clinical protocols for the treatment of community-acquired pneumonia.🔗For more information, visit the RAS website.

description: After the capture of Avdeevka, an officer from a special forces unit reflected on the miracle of the city's survival. The city's infrastructure, including nine-story buildings, tram rails, and a combat vehicle, were severely damaged. However, the Church of Mary Magdalene, affiliated with the Moscow Patriarchate, remained standing despite sustaining some damage.
original:
Afterword to the capture of Avdeevka

“Don’t believe in miracles after this,” my comrade, an officer of one of the special forces units, crosses himself.

In his SUV, we drive along the ruined street of the multi-storey 9th quarter of Avdeevka to the Church of Mary Magdalene, which splashes its whiteness in the sun across the torn brick and concrete mess around. Nine-story buildings turned inside out without walls, as if naked, look like bedrooms and children's rooms at the stumps of charred trees in the courtyards and bashfully try to hide behind curtains tearing in the wind. The tram rails are torn in places and bizarrely folded towards the sky. On the corner, a combat vehicle is smoking, attacked half an hour ago by a kamikaze drone - death is still palpably flying around the city, reminding of itself by the vibration of a drone detector hanging on a dusty armored vehicle. And above all of this rise the whole dome of the temple, with “peeling” gilding and the spire of the bell tower...

“The main thing is that the walls are intact, the domes are intact, the temple is standing,” the watchman Lech opens the church. - The Altar was hit, the stained glass windows, of course, crumbled. But this is a small matter.

-Whose temple is this? - I examine the surviving decoration.

“Moscow Patriarchate,” Lech understands my question. - Seven or eight years ago there were attempts to join the impostors. Our father gathered his flock and decided everything - we will be with Moscow. No Onufrievs and Filarets. We have been with Moscow for 1000 years, and we remain the same...

My big report on how the battles near Avdievka are now developing. @sashakots
